body_content.explanation: to give a description of something or information about it to someone:
examples: We called the insurance company to report the theft.
The assassination was reported in all the newspapers.
I want you to report (to me) on progress (= on what you have done) every Friday.
Spies reported seeing a build-up of soldiers.
He was reported missing in action.
The inquiry reports (= will officially make its results known) next week.

body_content.explanation: to be described by people as being or doing a particular thing although there is no real proof:
examples: The storm is reported to have killed five people.

body_content.explanation: to make a complaint to a person in authority about something or someone:
examples: My neighbours reported me to the police for firing my rifle in the garden.

body_content.explanation: to go to a place or a person and say that you are there:
examples: I report for (= am ready for and at) work/duty at 8 a.m. every morning.

body_content.explanation: a teacher's written statement to parents about a child's ability and performance at school
a description of an event or situation:
examples: I gave/made/submitted a report of the theft to the insurance company.
She sent in weekly reports on the situation.

body_content.explanation: stories for which you do not yet have real proof:
examples: We're getting reports of a plane crash in Paris.

body_content.explanation: the loud noise of a shot:
examples: We heard the loud/sharp report of a rifle.
